text: If we had an issue with templates we cloned to a client portal not showing up in a root folder who would need to know and can help us solve it? <@U22PWJ41G>?

Has anyone been having issues with Flex Columns in the drag and drop DM2? For some reason I can't drag items into flex columns and when custom modules are inside of the flex columns the fields to edit are not showing up. I also can't add modules to certain flex columns, the page editor just errors out.
Do you mind messaging me with a link?

we’ve been seeing a lot of issues with the page editor for the last week or so. - when you add a new module sometimes it freezes with the loading dots moving on the screen(javascript error) we’ve seen issues where modules can’t be edited when you click on them in edit modules. probably related to what you’re seeing Reg

not sure if it helps but in our specific situation we’re on a site that has design manager 2 but the majority of the pages on the site and all of the modules except one, are still design manager 1(they haven’t been upgraded)
yeah, thats exactly whats happening.
<@U2H1Q3F8R> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U2H1Q3F8R/FA8BAA0JZ/page-editor.mp4|page-editor.mp4>
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
So, any solutions on how I can fix this up? Supposed to have this site ready for final revision by tomorrow LOL.
Right now it looks like I may have to just make a template for each page without Flex ability?

Unrelated to previous more important issue: The html+hubl,css,js panes in the new custom module interface don’t act as expected when clicked.

Expected behavior is:
<https://spin.d.pr/eecAOU+>
(this is from codepen)

Behavior in HubSpot is kinda spotty works kinda strangely. sometimes it will show the arrow dropped down even though the pane didn’t resize.
<https://spin.d.pr/dSg3wW+>
Here’s the workaround that seems to be working for us: whenever you need to edit a page  whose template was the old DM toggle off the new design manager
it seems to fix the issues
Logically - I’m not sure why they would tie any of their code in the page editor to whether the new design manager is enabled or not as it’s supposed to handle both
All these templates were built in the new DM. They weren't converted.

oh interesting, so maybe my team’s assumption is wrong.

Are you using custom modules that were built in new or old DM?
just wondering if it’s caused by trying to use a mix of both
no, all the custom modules were built with the new DM

seems like the only consistent things then are that the new design manager is enabled on a site.

<@U22PJPGK0> not sure who to tag on this issue but I can confirm I’m seeing it consistently and sounds like Reg is too

<@U2H1Q3F8R> let us know if you have any success with toggling off the new design manager prior to editing a page.

It’s working for us but since the pages and modules don’t use the new design manager, that could be a specific scenario
Another note: ctrl+z doesn’t work in the new custom module interface. It’s driving me bonkers :scream:
<@U22PNRAJD>
I'm honestly scared to switch the templates to the old DM as they weren't built in there along with all of the custom modules that were built. Seems risky.
:eyes:
<@U7SL518D6> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U7SL518D6/FA8BX0L1K/download.jpeg|I don't make syntax errors but when I do -ctrl+Z [I don't make syntax errors]>
sent
Reg, the templates and modules don’t actually switch when you switch which interface you’re using

They stay upgraded. It’s just the interface that changes. You just wont be able to edit the new modules in the design manager till you toggle it back on again. So basically our current solution is when editing a page revert to DM1, We’re still developing in the new DM, so we toggle it back on when we’re working in that.
ohhhh ok - I can give that a shot.
If I could give this more than one thumbs up I would give this a thousand.
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.

Hey! I’m starting to take a look at this but I seem to be misinterpreting the issue. Could you describe where this is happening and an example on how to reproduce the issue? I’m using ctrl+z in a custom module and it’s working fine.
are you in the new design manager? I can't use ctrl+z when doing anything in the new DM custom module. I'm using Chrome latest build.
for example, in the DMv2 CM I a simply typing anything in and them doing ctrl+z to undo the typing and nothing is happening. but if i click "Undo" at the top, it undoes things
Yup I’m using the new design manager and ctrl+z works for me in custom modules. Could you send me a direct link to a custom module that has this issue?
Welp. I was trying last night (and all last week) and it didn’t work.  Seems to be working now. Spooky :scream: ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
Jonah was just working on it
Oh, he did fix it?
<@UA7JFQSQ0> were you able to fix it?

Not yet, seems to be an issue on windows so debugging/testing the issue is an issue since we’re all on macs. Hopefully it shouldn’t be long but it’ll take some more time to fix this. We’re having other issues surrounding key bindings so we also need to take a look there.
Ohhh true, it’s on windows only. Just tried
